Description:
Detects changes of sensitive and critical files. Monitors files that you don't expect to change without planning on Linux system.

Author: @d4ns4n_ (Wuerth-Phoenix)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Potential Suspicious Change To Sensitive/Critical Files
Query: sourcetype like 'linux-%' eql select * from _source_ where ((((process_path like '%/cat' or process_path like '%/echo' or process_path like '%/grep' or process_path like '%/head' or process_path like '%/more' or process_path like '%/tail') and command like '%>%') or (process_path like '%/emacs' or process_path like '%/nano' or process_path like '%/sed' or process_path like '%/vi' or process_path like '%/vim')) and (command like '%/bin/login%' or command like '%/bin/passwd%' or command like '%/boot/%' or command like '%/etc/*.conf%' or command like '%/etc/cron.%' or command like '%/etc/crontab%' or command like '%/etc/hosts%' or command like '%/etc/init.d%' or command like '%/etc/sudoers%' or command like '%/opt/bin/%' or command like '%/sbin%' or command like '%/usr/bin/%' or command like '%/usr/local/bin/%'))
